Class EvilHangmanGame

java.lang.Object
  EvilHangmanGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
HangmanGame
public class EvilHangmanGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements HangmanGame

The EvilHangmanGame class is an implementation of the HangmanGame interface that elusively does not select the chosen word unless the latest possible time. This class, however, does attempt to deceive the user by providing an accurate pattern for the guessed characters.

Author:
Zach Souser

guess

public int guess(char guess)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Guess a character. Sorts the dictionary based on the occurrence of the guessed character. Then the largest set of words matching the guessed character replaces the working dictionary and the corresponding pattern applies

Specified by:
guess in interface HangmanGame
Parameters:
guess - the guessed character
Returns:
the number of occurrences of the guessed character in the goal word
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
